metadata.title: CVE-2019-9453 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In the Android kernel in F2FS touch driver there is a possible out ofbounds read due to improper input validation. This could lead to localinformation disclosure with system execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9453` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
No subscription required

linux-image-5.0.0-31-generic - 5.0.0-31.33~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-31.33~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1043.43').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-5.3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1016.17~18.04.1').
